subject: RE: [junit] Commercial use of Junit - license issues
msgSnippet: Dear Chris, Three Rivers Consulting, Inc. (my commercial persona) is willing and able to license JUnit under commercial terms. Quoting from the license
messageBody:
Dear Chris,

Three Rivers Consulting, Inc. (my commercial persona) is willing and able to
license JUnit under commercial terms. Quoting from the license agreement, "A
Contributor may choose to distribute the Program in object code form under
its own license agreement". Please have the office contact me for terms.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Consulting, Inc.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of cchaulk
> Sent: Tuesday, May 30, 2006 12:00 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Commercial use of Junit - license issues
>
> I am interested in using Junit internally (not for
> distribution) at my
> company for some product testing. However, our open source office is
> very concerned about the IBM Common Public License and its
> applicability to users and distributors of Junit and possible patent
> infringements.
>
> Can anyone comment on this concern ? If Kent or Erich are listening,
> can Junit by licensed under an alternate open-source or
> commercial license ?
>
>
>
> Chris Chaulk
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
